most_active_tickets.title: Auto Generated Context Always returns to Medium

common_issues.title: Pieces user settings not saving across sessions
common_issues.description: Users report that settings in both the VS Code extension and desktop app are not persisting.  The VS Code extension repeatedly prompts for login despite Pieces OS running.  The desktop app's Auto-Generated Context setting reverts to "Medium" after being changed. This occurs across Windows and macOS platforms and persists across app and OS updates.  Troubleshooting steps should include verifying login status, checking for conflicts with other extensions or software, and ensuring settings files are properly saved and loaded.

related_issues.title: Pieces in VS code
related_issues.text: Pieces in VS code ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application, VS Code ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.1.0 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. Hello, I have an updated version of Pieces OS 12.1.0, and Pieces Desktop 4.3.1. I try to use the Pieces extension in VS code, but always asking me to sign in and run Pieces OS (what is running on startup automaticly) I clicked sing in but I only receive an error: I dont know If this is related to that I have only the standard account or not. Thank you for your help and feedback. related_issues.title: Auto Generated Context Always returns to Medium
related_issues.text:
Auto Generated Context Always returns to Medium
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Platform MacOS Version 15.5 (Build 24F74)

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hello!

This is an issue that I've seen happen in all of the builds since I've started using pieces. When changing the Auto-Generated Context (Saved Material Enrichment) option in Machine Learning from the menu, in my case I want it to be "High", but every time I change it, when I check the next day or any time later, or every time the app or os updates, the option selected goes back to "Medium". So I don't actually even know if it ever used "High", because it always returns the option to "Medium".
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Prioritize resolving the user settings bug affecting both VS Code extension and desktop app, focusing on persistence across sessions and platforms.
Investigate the root cause of the "Pieces in VS Code" login issue, including potential conflicts with standard accounts.
Address the Auto-Generated Context setting reverting to "Medium" in the desktop app, ensuring settings are saved and loaded correctly.
Improve communication with users regarding known issues and their resolution progress.
